subject: Medicine
title: Glial Cells: The Unsung Heroes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Glial Cells: The Unsung Heroes.

hook.text: For every neuron in your brain, there's roughly one glial cell supporting it. They were ignored for decades.

buildup.text: Glial cells provide structure, nutrition, insulation, and waste removal for neurons.

discovery.text: Astrocytes regulate blood flow to active brain regions. Microglia act as the brain's immune system.

twist.text: Einstein's brain had an unusually high ratio of glial cells. They may contribute more to thinking than assumed.

climax.text: New research shows glial cells actively participate in signaling, not just supportâ€”rewriting neuroscience.

punchline.text: The brain's support crew may be secret stars.

quiz.question: What surprising finding emerged about Einstein's brain?
options: It had an unusually high ratio of glial cells
It had twice as many neurons as average
It was significantly larger than a normal brain
